content: extranilla socks by meaghan schmaltz the story i ve had multiple requests for a detailed pattern to knit my favorite vanilla socks pattern with counter color cuffs heels and toes so without further ado - here she is my favorite vanilla socks with a little extra oomph - extranilla materials main color 300-400 yds fingering weight yarn counter color 125 yds fingering weight yarn us 1½ 2 50mm 32-inch circular needle or preferred length adjust needle size as necessary to match gauge removable stitch marker 1 stitch markers 2 finished sizes 7 8 9 inch circumference recommended fit 1-inch neg ease gauge 32 sts and 48 row = 4 inches stockinette in the round notes stitch glossary these socks are worked from the cuff down feature a modified eye beg of round - beginning of round of partridge gusset heel and use the kitchener stitch to close the toe cc - counter color decrease - decreased jogless stripe techniques are employed at the color changes to increase - increased minimize the stair step effect often seen when changing colors at the k - knit end of a round k2tog - knit 2 sts together 1 st decrease mc - main color this pattern includes written instructions only make 2 socks to p - purl complete a pair p2tog - purl 2 sts together 1 st decrease repeat - repeat instructions are given for smallest size with additional sizes in rh - right hand parentheses when only one set of instructions is given it applies to round s - round s all sizes rs - right side sl - slip_stitch slip all sts purlwise unless otherwise noted ssk - slip 1 stitch knitwise slip a second stitch knitwise move these 2 stitches back to the left needle and k2tog tbl this pattern is written for the magic loop technique however any 1 st decrease method of circular knitting may be substituted in case of using st s - stitch es dpns assume that the front needle is synonymous with needles 1 & tbl - through back loop 2 and that the back needle is synonymous with needles 3 & 4 ws - wrong side note required yardage will vary based on the size of sock being knit the yardage above assumes the largest sock circumference and a very long foot the sample socks knit in the medium size for a women s size 6½ shoe used only 80 yds if you find any errors or have any questions please feel free of cc and 220 yds of mc plan accordingly to e-mail me directly meaghan@unapologeticknitter com page 1 of 3 @notsorryknitter on ravelry instagram ello & twitter | unapologeticknitter com | the unapologetic knitter on facebook & youtube cuff turn the heel work the gusset kitchener stitch using cc and preferred stretchy cast-on german twisted with ws facing continuing to knit flat on the back needle round 1 needle 1 knit to 2 sts before marker ssk sm knit to end
